lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we do!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Apparently, someone's got mail on Drag Race!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was like standing at the dock going, "Three, two, one, jump!" and Travis was the only one who jumped in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, well done, though. Welcome guys! Before we jump into tonight's episode, we have some announcements to get through. First and foremost, returning once again this week, our fantastic partners and sponsor for the beginning of this campaign, D&D Beyond! An awesome Dungeons & Dragons tool for use for your campaigns, whether you be DM or player, and Sam, do you have anything to say about that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Check it out at twitch.tv/dndbeyond and to celebrate, I'm giving out a prize tonight. It's another contest, all of you can play, and here's the rules: using D&D Beyond, you have to create a character, right now, a level three character, any character, go!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: On our app?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?! That's going to take so long!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (intense timer countdown song)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on, it's refreshing! You should've given us warning!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) D&D&D&D Beyond. D&D Beyond! D&D!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Aw, damn it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? I don't see it. It's there. She did it.

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: I did it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sphincter, Sphincter, Sphincter!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, you know what? I don't know how to call it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have 138 hit points?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow! Wait, at a level three character? No, she's level 15!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Callous, 25 hit points! Already done, right there!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, Taliesin wins. See how easy it is to create a character with D&D Beyond?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A level three blood hunter earth elemental.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll give you a hint: your prize is attached to my mug.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, wait, wait! No, leave it! Put it back, I want to do this properly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What're you doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you just--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You hit Randomize Your Character.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you see how easy it is? We all created a character in, like, 25 seconds!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This random character that I just created is really fucking cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm actually really impressed with this fucking character.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Aw, I don't want to have Sphincter next to Caleb now!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, you really named it "Sphincter?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. That's the name I gave them! That's as far as I got! Delete. Oh, there goes Caleb.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is your name? Panalanalam-- Pana--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Panlanann.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There are four "N's" in that name.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am Panlanann, the wood half-elf blood hunter!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What was yours, Taliesin?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Callous.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Callous? What was yours, Laura?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was Alight, a level 15 fire genasi.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Her name was Alight?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Alight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am Eomita Deephollow, lightfoot halfling fighter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dude, my abilities are balls, though. I have a five dex and a four wisdom. That's sad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're using those characters for the next campaign.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no, no! No!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, you got dope stats!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because I'm awesome.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look how fucking crap these are!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're in big trouble.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you very much, Sam, congratulations Taliesin, and thank you D&D Beyond for being our sponsor. Quick reminder to those of you who have an Amazon Prime account, you can get a free subscription to the Twitch channel by going through your actual-- yeah, you do it through Twitch! You link your Amazon Prime account to your Twitch name and you are able to subscribe to one channel for free a month. If you have not subscribed and you want to have the VODs available to you before they go up on Youtube, that's the way to do it, for no additional charge. Check it out. Talks Machina--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sam, stop touching my shit. Look at that! He rolled ones, ones, and ones!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kids!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sorry. Sorry, Matthew.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's okay. We haven't started yet, so technically it's a buffer. Talks Machina, next Tuesday at 7:00pm Pacific. We'll be here on Twitch and Project Alpha where our host, Brian W. Foster, will discuss what happens and transpires in this episode tonight, so check it out next week on Tuesday. The podcast of last week's episode is available for download, so those of you who missed last episode or want to listen to it on your drive or commute, or you just like the audio to create your imagination-scape, last week's episode is available to download now wherever finest podcasts are located to be downloaded. Any other major announcements from you guys?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A little thing that is totally improvised. A couple of weeks ago, a Critter named Courtney-- forgive me if I'm getting that wrong-- She tweeted a picture of her with this scarf that she was making for Caleb, and she made the hashtag #ScarvesForCaleb and then people started talking about it. I retweeted because I thought it was awesome, and they came up with the idea to make scarves for Caleb-- But not for me-- to give to shelters: Homeless shelters, to veterans, to anyone who needs scarves or hats or mittens. I think it's a great idea, and you would make me happy. This is beautiful, I love it, thank you, but don't pile me up in scarves. Send them to people who need them. I just think it would be a nice thing to do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back. Last we left off, our gathering of friends have been traversing northward along the Amber Road, with the distant destination of Zadash, one of the larger cities of the Dwendalian Empire, as your destination. Upon traveling, you passed a caravan, spent an evening amongst trees, where you found a wayward cluster of wandering buffalo...-like creatures. You continued northward for a second day, rushed on past sunset to rest in the city of Alfield, a small farming town that's along the way to Zadash. However, upon noticing that some of the buildings in the eastern side of town began to light up with flame, you began to approach rather rapidly, seeing members of the city, citizens fleeing and screaming, and there seemed to be some sort of attack. Upon going into the town, you realized that a number of these buildings are being set fire by an incursion of gnolls. You were immediately brought in by Watchmaster Bryce, who offered to pay you for each set of gnoll ears that were brought to them, and you jumped into the fray, managed to kill quite a few, many of them still left with their quarry, it seems, which happened to be quite a number of bodies and/or citizens still living, that were dragged off into the ashen and cloud-covered night. Upon returning, many of you bruised, beaten, and at one point in danger of worse, you were given an evening's rest at the Feed and Mead Tavern, and were told, if you were interested in pursuing future coin in helping with the current conflict nearing the city, to meet Bryce out by the Broad Barn.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: The Broad Barn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's why I wrote Broad Barn down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is why.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wrote "Rod Barn."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a different place entirely. You guys all bundled up into a singular room above the floor of the Feed and Mead. Found yourselves exhausted, passed out, and got an evening's rest, so you've all gotten a long rest. You've healed up. You've recovered your abilities. As the uncomfortable warmth of the morning kicks in, with your small room and number of warm bodies encompassing a very tight and not very drafty space, the partially humid early hours draw you from consciousness. You all begin to stretch your sore muscles and decide what endeavors await you with the new day. What do you guys want to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you guys want to do today?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That bed was not my favorite.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I liked it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Little stiff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's actually really good support.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's good for your back, it's really true.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You use a pillow, or are you just on the floor?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you have to pray over your swords or anything this morning?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, everything's fine. They just do what they need to do. I just have to keep them clean.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, well, we were sharing a room one night, and Molly has a ritual. I think it's part of his custom. Yeah, he performs over his swords.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have to take care of them or else they'll stop working, of course.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do they need to feed?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They do actually, yeah. I've got to feed them some, well-- it's complicated. I don't like to go too deep into it, but I've got to use my bloodline on occasion. Actually, since we're already on the road, I should be honest, I wasn't entirely telling the truth when I talked to you that night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No! Stop it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You seem so honest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, you're just a bundle of truth too, aren't you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is a bloodline?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I suppose it's only fair. I did tell you that these swords are special, and that they use the blood of my family to activate themselves. I know I might have said I was from a long line of priests, and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god, you killed your whole family.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't kill my whole family.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, okay. Never mind, keep going. I'm sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Our family were less the priests, and more the sacrifices. We may have stolen the swords and run. That's why I've been trying to keep a bit of a low profile when it comes to some of the authorities.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I mean, for fear of your life you ran?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's been a long time, but I'd rather not run into them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What gods were you being sacrificed to?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I couldn't tell you. It was my parents, I was just wee by the time that happened.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there a roving band of priests that are trying to find you right now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I hope not. I mean, it's been a long time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where's home? Where is this place that you stole--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My parents never spoke of it. Somewhere out east.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You got to the circus from that, how?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, it was a bit of a mess, but I just ended up there eventually. Just looking for a place where I could rest, I suppose?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's funny, you gave me an answer, but you didn't really give me an answer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I don't know you that well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what he's been doing this whole time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That requires a drink.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I understand that sentiment. Trying to find a little respite, a little peace.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a good place to be if you want to run, but not run.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there any others of your family out there on the run?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not that I've ever met.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was it just your parents and you that were being sacrificed?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You know, I don't know. I never thought to ask.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did they want to kill you or just take your blood?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Apparently they needed us alive for it, so there was that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! So it wasn't so bad, they just slowly drained you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Doesn't sound that bad. Yeah, they're not going to kill you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So I was told.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Isn't that what you're doing to yourself on a daily basis?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not that bad, though, it doesn't leave a mark really.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're in control of it. You're using it for yourself?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yes, of course. It can come in handy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it have to be your blood?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yes. Of our bloodline, apparently.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have you tried any other bloodlines?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would you like to take a run at it? You could be lucky.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll save that for another day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I had a funny feeling.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm tempted.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What about you, Fjord? Are you going to vomit any seawater this morning?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (retching)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, watch out!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Could've been worth five copper on the open road at one point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I seem to have missed my calling.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Always could use a circus geek.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How'd you sleep, aside from the crappy bed?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know what you're asking. I didn't have any other dreams. It was fairly restful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No dreams at all?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: None I care to speak of.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we think there's anything left of this town?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That is a question.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anything left?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It didn't seem like the whole thing was on fire.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We couldn't quite see it at night, that's true. Maybe we should go down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would like to take a walk and see what it is we're out to save.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can steal some things!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe we do that second, and first we take a walk.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How do we get paid? There was talk of pay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought we already got paid.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We did, but Molly was drinking, so maybe he does not remember.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He said he was going to bring the rest, I think, later.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got to say, there's worse ways to make a living.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I counted 60 gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, Molly, didn't you say Bryce said it would come later?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bryce had said if you wanted to continue to help with this then there was more money.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's keep helping!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I mean, it's not a bad gig.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could stay here forever and just kill gnolls.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was very scary. One of them almost killed me!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But think about how good we would get over time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true. The 10,000-hour rule?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nott the gnoll killer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, we agreed not to put anyone in harm's way in an excessive manner.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When did we agree that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did we not?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't remember that, either.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't recall making that arrangement.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did we agree to that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe I thought that was an unspoken thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Usually when you agree to something you have to say it out loud. Most of the time. Unless it's, like-- We just agreed to it! You said it, you said it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What did you agree to?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't tell, it's a secret! Oh! But she's serious about it, I can tell!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're so good at this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, my social anxiety is getting the best of me. I'm taking a walk. Goodbye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door slams behind Caleb briskly making his exit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want a donut this morning? It's a little more stale in the bag, I have to let you know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think I'm fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yeah. More donut for us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess we should greet the town.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait! When did we say we were going to meet Bryce?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why are you yelling?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought they were leaving.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Actually, I think they'll find us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Maybe we could just stand in the middle of town and go, "Bryce?" until they show up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In front of Broad Barn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I have a question about this Broad Barn thing. Is Broad Barn the name of an establishment, or is Broad Barn a very broad barn?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a very long barn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a very big barn?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if it's a street? We didn't clarify, did we?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if it's a tavern? I don't know, I got confused in his delivery.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bet we can ask the guy downstairs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He seemed nice last night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We go downstairs.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll follow for this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a Zork game. We go down the stairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, apparently. You head downstairs to the only other real location within the Feed and Mead Tavern. There's Crute still there off to the side and one very dirty and ashy civilian who is currently slowly scarfing a meal with a thousand yard stare. Looks like they had been close to the action and chaos the evening before. As you walk down, Crute looks across and goes, "I see you're "awake. Would you like breakfast?"

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. It'll be about an hour. Because it's just me."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: An hour? All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's just me."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want some help? I'll come help you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Come on!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll go in for this if it means a faster breakfast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two of you jump in with Crute in what is a not very well-kept kitchen, but functional. The gristle, who knows how long it's been there. It might add to the flavor, who knows.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A-rating for the city of Los Angeles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll put it at a B in Panorama City.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow, that's an in-joke.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys go ahead and help out. It does manage to cut down the time for breakfast preparation. Eventually food is presented.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: After we've cooked, I'm going to switch out his salt for his sugar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a sleight of hand check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to see if I see this. I don't, do I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're too caught up in the meal-making.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yeah, I definitely don't see this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Neither does Crute, as you manage to do so swiftly. Practiced, like you've done this before in many other establishments in the past, maybe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: After we cooked.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You just give us all diabetes, that's great.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The frittatas are going to taste real weird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys finish your breakfast, the rest of the day is yours.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What does the town look like when we step out front? How bad is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you emerge from the tavern-- and Caleb, you've already seen this-- you see that the fires have now been reduced to maybe a dozen wide plumes of gray-white smoke on the eastern side of the city. It rises from the ashes and charred wood remains and wood frames where some buildings used to be. It seemed much more dangerous and chaotic last evening, but looking at it now in the day, it's no more than maybe a dozen buildings or so that were affected. They were more centralized to cause the most chaos suddenly at that time of night. You get the sense as soon as you look around that the folks of the city are on edge, understandably so. You see the people are trying to pick up their lives and move on in the face of what recently occurred. The very air holds this tension as you look around you. People walk past you with sacks of grain and tools, their eyes wide, darting around for unseen danger and glancing past the two tieflings, immediately, instinctually step back a bit and make a wide berth. You watch children run from doorway to doorway, trying to stay out of the street as long as possible. It seems like it's trying to carry on, but it's going to be a process. Some folks are rummaging through the remains of the respective buildings. You glance over near where the central portion of your conflict last night took place, where the Candleglow Tavern is, and there you see, amongst the smoldering rubble of the inn, a single halfling man sifts through the wreckage, a crownsguard helping him lift heavier beams. You see as he plucks what he can of his former life from the rubble.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we go over and talk to him?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we recognize this person?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have not met this person, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're a halfling, too, so maybe you should talk to him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not technically.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to walk over.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll join. We'll just go over and scare the shit out of him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Need a hand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he pulls through some of the rubble and he's making a small pile on the side, he looks up and goes, "Oh, right. Can I help you?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We were part of this commotion last night. We were wondering if you need a hand with anything right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, if you don't--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm taking off my jacket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Name's Thadeus. Thadeus Candleglow."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, this was your place?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It was."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "20 years since I was left this place. Built by my grandpaps, Reedus."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Were you here when the attack happened?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I was here. When they all came in, I was gone. I wasn't about to stay around, you know?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you happen to see where they came from?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I did not. I was in the process of cleaning dishes and dealing with a couple of my "patrons. One of them--" and he points over to the rubble. You can see what looks to be a skeletal body that's been partially collapsed. "I suppose Leiman's probably not going to be a regular anymore."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You going to rebuild, give him a fine plaque?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think I'm probably going to gather what I can "here and shop up north and see what other work I can get myself to."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much gold do you need?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know. A building establishment like this. I'm not entirely certain, but I could check "in. I assume it's probably a few thousand gold pieces for the structure."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just had that, too! I'm sorry, I don't have it anymore. But I could try writing to my mom to see if she'll help you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's really sweet."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or, as another thought, since you were basically robbed, who were they? What happened? Has this happened before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, this hasn't happened as long as I've been here, and I've been here most of my life, "here in Alfield. You hear about these things wandering on the outside, and you know crownsguard "keeps you safe. Anything comes too close, they just shoot them in the face with a bunch of arrows "and shit."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I love him so much!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thadeus, did they seem to be after anything in particular? Were they here for property or people or gold or food?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They didn't take any of the worthwhile stuff, thankfully." He points over to a pile and you can see there's some brass urn or vase that's been smashed and dented by the conflict. You can see bits and pieces of a few keepsakes that might be worth a little bit of money that have been brought out. "They just mainly took all of our food stores. Most of my meats, most of my salted "meats, the dried meats, the fresh meats, the butchered meats. They cleared out the butcher down "the street."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shrimp scampi. Butterfly shrimp.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Coconut shrimp.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fried shrimp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't engage them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're all going to die now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's a real curious-looking face you got there."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excuse me, I saw in the middle of the fray-- Sir. Excuse me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In Halfling, I say to him, I've also been a victim of a horrible attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, minus. Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What can I do?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sorry, I was part of the fray as well. I was right in the thick of it. I saw a cart piled high with bodies. Are there people missing from town?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Quite a few. You'd have to ask around some of the crownsguard."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How has the rest of the village fared? Is everything as poorly off as you are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm more worried about the folks that were plucked from their homes."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is yours the only business that was hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I haven't looked around, to be perfectly honest. I've been a little focused on--" and he gestures out with his hands at the rubble that was once his life.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You had a lot of meat, didn't you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, you have to present meat. A lot of people around here eat meat."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would you say that you offer a larger selection of meat than some of the other establishments in town?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't know about quantity, but quality was--" (tongue click)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like I've been robbed of the experience of your fine, fine meat products, and I, for one, would like you to rebuild so that I might try some of your meats.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, if at some point the gracious gods see fit to bequeath upon me a strike of good luck "and I can get to rebuilding, my friend, one day, you may be able to try one of my meats."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take a look-- Is the friend who's dead skeletonized?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, yeah, burnt charred.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, burnt, okay. Where is this butcher that you mentioned as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh that's--" He steps out through where the doorframe is still standing, the one that you defended yourself through most of that battle, just a free-standing frame now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Was I in the butcher's? Because that would be some real horror-level shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think you were in the barbecue shack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's kind of awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He points over to a building across the way, which is one of the buildings that was nearby. He says, "That there's the Ruddy Top Butcher, well, what remains of it," and you can see that building too. It's still standing, and it's nowhere near as damaged as the Candleglow Inn, but it's sustained quite a bit of damage, and it looks like the roof has fallen in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sorry, Mollymauk, another question for you: Is there maybe-- I hope it is still standing-- but a supply store?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, if you're looking for farming supplies, general supplies, there's--"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sorry, I'm in the need of some incense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, you could probably find something like that there, The Broad Barn."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! It's a store!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Question answered. I'm sorry, I'm standing by Fjord. Question answered!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like half a question, because you're wondering why it's called that at this point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bet it's big.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At least wide.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "At one time it was a barn, but the farm stopped giving up crop, and so they converted the "barn itself into what was a general store, because they started selling off the tools they didn't "need, but that made them more money than the crops did that year, so we started importing more tools, "and for the past 30 years the Broad Barn has been our commonly known general supply place there on "the western side of Alfield, so if you want to--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is really fascinating.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, this is a really good talk that we've had.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you just out-talk Jester?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think I'm going to go look for the Broad Barn

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's an idea. Don't pack up shop just yet, we're going to see if we can do something about these terrible creatures that have been roaming around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we'll find all of those thousands of gold for you, and you can build your shop back up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, y'all look like you're geared up to be making a mess. You going after these things?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are, perhaps, persons of action.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're really tough. We have no fear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He leans in real close to you, getting on his tippy toes to meet your gaze, and he says, "Well, if you manage to go and kill some of them dog people, you tell them Thadeus Candleglow says hi."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She really will.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here. It's a moldy donut. Be well, child, the Traveler is with you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm not a child, but I appreciate the gesture."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know my name! I leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Gesture. Her name's Gesture!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It is a gesture, like Prince.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The adventurer formerly known as Jester. He takes a bite, and (spitting).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, I'm sorry, just between you and me, I know the look on your face a little bit, you seem a little manic. If you have friends you can stay with right now, you know you don't have to rebuild it today. I recommend you take it slow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't think I have much of a choice at the moment." He gives a long stare towards you that fades past a little bit beyond. "Anyway, I should get back to picking up the pieces. Excuse "me," and starts gathering more stuff from the rubble, and the crownsguard behind goes over and takes the things he's already gathered, and begins putting them into a small crate, and doesn't engage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: While they were having that conversation, I'm hanging back with Fjord, if you're cool with that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Question: If you were a crazy, ravenous, dog humanoid person thing, what would make you really hungry all of a sudden? I didn't phrase that question very well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I knew where you were going with it, though. How do we ring the dinner bells, is what you're saying. How do we get them to come to us?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. It seems like they're into meat? Kind of anything.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, they done took it all, I think.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, they're really hungry, more so now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why more so now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know. Why more so now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, they took all the Luby's Cafeteria with them, so I don't think they're going to be hungry for a bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But what if they are still hungry?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Then we would need to roast some meats.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know who else was really hungry out of fucking nowhere?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Big angry toad man. Devil toad guy. I feel like I should get better names for all these things.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. He was hungry all of a sudden?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know. I mean, it might be a coincidence.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You thinking some of them gnolls had some fiendish qualities, perhaps?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, considering some of them were undead.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There was that whole zombie gnoll thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I forgot all about that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. How could you forget that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have some weird dreams. What did you have in mind? Other nights.

lines.name: MARISHA, TRAVIS
lines.text: What? (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I legitimately didn't understand what you said.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, nothing, I got shit in my teeth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you okay?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, fine. Did you have a plan? Did you want to do something to wrangle them--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was just striking conversation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, sorry. Well, maybe we'll follow them to the Barn Broad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, let's go to the Barn Broad.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Broad Barn. I was fucking with you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was going along with you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that's all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When did we hire Tom Stoppard to write this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. Seriously.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I couldn't deal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where are you guys off to?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To the Broad Barn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They've washed up from last night's damage and dirty conflict, so as they approach--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I turn to Jester, and I go, look inviting. Look heroic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm deeply sorry about that. Starosta Kosh is high-strung on a holiday, and tensions have "never been this high since he was assigned here eight years ago, so please don't take that to "heart. He's just a--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Your words, not mine."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Seems some people handle pressure better than others. He doesn't seem like the handling type.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No. Those in higher political positions rarely do, it seems. Anyway, I want to thank you "all again for your aid last night. I can't fathom the further death toll, had you not been there and "jumped in selflessly as you did. Thank you." Bryce trails off and looks back towards where Starosta Kosh had stormed off and goes, "Fucking Dwendalian political bullshit. We've needed a more trained "guard here for weeks, especially with Xhorhas bleeding into the valley, but we're far too south "to matter. Any request has been declined due to all necessary forces being needed at the garrisons "by Brokenveil. If they were doing their jobs at the Bluffs, we wouldn't have so many reports of "violent beasts in the valley in the first place, but here we are. At least I've gotten approval for "a bit more cash. To that, while I do not know what your business here is in Alfield, if you are still "interested, we are in need of some skilled mercenary work."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to kill all of them!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We couldn't help but overhear that you were asking for some aid. How long were you thinking you might need these replacements?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, until at least this threat has been dealt with in a satisfactory way. I've "unfortunately not had my scouts return after they were sent the night before, which does not "bode well, but I suspect that we should see some sort of hopeful backup sent by Zadash or "Bladegarden within the next week or two. In the meantime, we're a bit of a sitting duck scenario, so I've "sent a few guards to go to Zadash to see what other mercenaries could be sent forward. We do "have some folks traveling along the road and will keep an eye out to see if anybody else is looking "for some coin, but for now, you are our first line of defense. Or offense, if you will."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I think I speak for all of us, we're certainly up to the task for a bit. Well, maybe for a little less than a bit. Can I ask, are there any other threats to this town, besides those gnolls?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, there are plenty of threats. Let's see, famine, syphilis--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Things that come on legs and with weapons, I mean.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Syphilis can come with legs--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like that was worth pointing out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why do both of you know that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're not wrong."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tiefling thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This backwards place has its fair share of issues, as I've come to learn as being not from "the region, but it seems to me that nothing on this scale has quite assaulted in some time. I "mean, there have been wandering rumors of terrible things and creatures wandering past the Xhorhas "border for as long as the Dwendalian Empire has been around. It's the whole reason that the "garrison's up north. But this far south, generally the guard can keep things at bay. This is a very "organized thing, I don't like it. I don't like it at all."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's new, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, this is new. Nothing on this scale."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It seems, from what we've seen, that they were hungry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've done a bit of research overnight, and it seems that gnolls are known to be very "aggressively hungry creatures. Could say famished to the point of obsession."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel their pain.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can understand that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you wish to hire us. How much? We are very experienced, but we'd like to know what we're talking about in advance. What kind of money are we talking about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The deal stands. 30 gold per gnoll ear, proof of a dead gnoll. If you can recover any of "the missing townsfolk here in Alfield and bring them back safely, I'd be willing to pay 25 gold a "head, returned."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if we find a dead body and bring it back?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there some lesser number for those?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There is, because even if they are gone, we would wish to bury those we've lost. I could "probably muster ten gold per retrieved member of the Alfield citizenry."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Specifically their heads, too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Preferably all of them. Whatever you can find."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is permissible, is what they're saying here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Seeing what these creatures did last night, I don't know what state you'll find any of "them, but I'm being hopeful."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you know what area they might have gone to?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They seemed to be heading east, to a northeast direction. That's where the scouts went "before they left. I wish I had more information for you, but that may be the place to start."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could you tell us at least what the landscape is like in that direction, what is over there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are some older, long grown-over settlements "that have been abandoned. Small-scale, but honestly, beyond here it's mainly fields."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bet we can find some ghosts.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I always love a ruin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If I might offer some advice: If you do see a ghost, don't engage."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know where they are? So we know how to steer clear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My dear, there are ghosts everywhere in this world. It's far more ancient than you assume."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bryce, some of these gnolls were undead, or raised from the dead. Do you have any inkling as to why, or have you seen that problem around here before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know as to why, but it's not uncommon, from what I could ascertain. Whatever "dark powers they worship, it seems, allows some to progress beyond death. Rumors are that when gnolls "go hungry and left to feed on each other, what remains rises to fight alongside those that still live."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would be why some of them have chunks missing out of them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This comes from research you have done, that you have read up on? Would you be able to share this reading with me, so that we are fully prepared?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Honestly, I just shared with you most of all that I had learned."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a small book.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: More of a pamphlet, actually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The only other bit of information I was able to pull from that was, they have this thing, "this entity that they worship. It has a name." Pulls out a few small notes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fire hydrant.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does it start with an A? Sometimes if you go down through the alphabet, A, B--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're saying this, they pull a small series of notes from their pocket. "Yeenoghu."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With a Y? That would have taken forever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let that be a lesson, young halfling.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With a Y? Yeenogru?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Yeenoghu.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know how to pronounce it, I only read it. I apologize."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I know anything about Yeenoghu?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a religion check. With advantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A religion check? 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ever-hungering, ever wandering to conquer and devour in its wake, leaving destruction, fetid meat, and waves of yipping, angry hyenas to devour what was left behind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry, another question. May I call you Bryce?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bryce. We were just about to go inside the barn here and get outfitted for this-- for many things, but especially now that we are going to go take care of this problem. Do you have any sort of pull with these people? Might we get any friendly--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Advance?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're not that flush.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's not so much about that, more than these aren't well-to-do people in their own right, "and right now, honestly, rebuilding--"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's asking a bit much, I was too forward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's all right. But you, as I know quite well from personal experience, have some coin to "your name. Perhaps that will be of aid to you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One last quick question, though. What do the gnolls normally eat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As far as I could tell, whatever living things they can get their hands on."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Those buffalo creatures that we see roaming around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Probably."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good to know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I will say, if there are any surviving captives, then haste is very much key. For if they "are as hungry as they seem, regardless of the massive volume they have acquired through the "evening, I know not how many their number is, or how hungry they are. Take too long, there may not "be much left to find."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll get this stuff and head right out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry, my curiosity gets the best of me, always. You are talking about buff-- "buffaro" creatures, or something? We saw these beasts on the outskirts of town. They look brown-furred, beast of burden-type creature? Do you know what those animals are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, yes. The valley aurochs."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Valley aurochs? Got it, thank you. All right, we should get ready for the road. Walking into the store.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was it hit at all? Was the store that we're going into destroyed at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, this was far enough west. It was mainly just a few buildings in the eastern side. Coming from where the woods were, it seemed like they were using cover of tree and canopy upon the incursion, then immediately assaulted partway into the eastern part of the city, burned it from the middle, and then used the flames to escape out the back. What were you about to say?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (gasps) Bryce?

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: (exaggerated coughing)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes? Are you all right?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, a lot on my mind. Speaking of the aurochs, I asked you yesterday if you'd heard if any of the farmers had had their cattle hit? You heard that yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I could ask around. It does happen on occasion."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fine. We'll ask on our way out. It's good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you'll excuse me, I do have something to get to. But good luck and godspeed."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have fun dealing with the dick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll do my best." Bryce turns around and leaves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did I recognize Starosta Kosh? Did he seem like the type that would have made a little side trip down to-- because he seems like the type.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was that a character-DM inside joke?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know; I feel like I learned something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intelligence check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm filing, I'm putting a wall between that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't read your dice at all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Intelligence, 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have seen this individual before. You were younger. Maybe eight or so years ago. Eight or nine years.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good to know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're just made of secrets, aren't you? Just made of secrets.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In my personal holdings-- I don't really remember putting this there-- but apparently I have five sticks of incense that I have no intention of using.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Will that do you any good?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, that would be worth about-- how much, DM?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What does this incense come from?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think it was part of a thing. I don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A pack or something?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's D&D Beyond. I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, so it's part of an adventuring pack, then.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think so, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would be negligible by comparison. I'd say maybe, at most, five silver's worth. At most.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is really very--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Changed your day, didn't it? Everything's coming up flowers now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, this has helped me immeasurably.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't mention it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, wait. How much incense do you need?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it depends on how much I want to do with it. I want my cat back. But I was in the realm of 15 or 20 gold I'm going to spend here today, if they have that much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: On incense?! And that five sticks was five silver's worth?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did anyone say that out loud?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She has a good eye for value.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is a lot of incense to burn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, there's a lot of parts to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's not quantity. It is the quality of the incense. And this was top-shelf, but I still need more. So, in we go. And then I say: Thank you, big guy. And I punch him and I walk in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As he walks away, I'm like: Ow! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think both of you do that, as you both separate.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keep up a good face for two seconds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If y'all need something, y'all just let me know."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy. West Virginia.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have any pickles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Y'all want pickles?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You seem like the type of place that would carry pickles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He leans back and rummages through what sounds like a small paper bag.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They come in barrels, usually. You get barrels of pickles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a small glass mason jar with two pickles and he goes, "I'm willing to part with "these here pickles!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it poop in a jar? Or is it pickles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's pickles. It looks like he may have just pulled it out of his lunch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Only you would put poop in a jar, Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I could part with them for around three copper?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is a good deal, sir, and I will give you the copper.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you need more copper? Are you all right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, hold on. No, I've got copper around somewhere.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, because I'll give you two copper if I get one of those pickles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay! Here, I pick some lint off one of the coppers that I have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes the copper from you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I pass him the two copper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes the copper from you. Slides forward the pickles and goes, (laughs) "Good deal!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excuse me. I just inhaled my own spit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't do that! That is not conducive to a lengthy lifetime."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Speak N Spell voice) I am okay. (as Caleb) I am needing a very fine kind of incense, and I don't know if that is the type of thing this establishment would carry, but it's very important. Do you have that sort of thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You want incense? That's fancy."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sorry, it's very noisy in the shop. What did you say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's really fancy, them incense."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, look at me. Can you not tell how fancy I am?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's why I'm curious."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well. You know, I've been on the road a long time and I'm carrying a smell with me, if you cannot tell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I got incense!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To the point, I like it. I would like to spend about 20 gold worth of incense. Do you have that much? I don't mean cheap shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What kind of establishment do you take me for?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it's a barn,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Touché." He wanders away from there and gathers any semblance of anything that could be considered incense to some degree. It's a massive volume, it's-- when he said quality over quantity, this is definitely a quantity circumstance. Two big burlap sacks filled with all sorts of fine ground herbs and things that could amount to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would like to make an insight check to make sure it's not oregano.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, where's the druid? That's what would be for oregano. That's Vex. This one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But she would know if you were swindling.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Perception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that'll be insight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Insight? Oh, that's much better. That is an

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: A what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: An elf.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Elf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He seems to be doing the best he can.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good. This is really good. I will give you 17 gold for all this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Deal!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One. Two. (continues counting)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: While he's counting this out, is there anyone else in the store? Anyone at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, there's three other people in the store, and they're slowly filtering out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I see any little trinkets or anything? Little brass things? Little baby bottles? Anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a few metallic joints that could be used for when you're tapping a keg. They have some keg taps there. They have-- oh my god.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're such a dick.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that one fell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 16. And I push the 16 gold forward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (slamming) "I appreciate your patronage."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: These are heavy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know this may be a stretch, but do you have maybe any healing potions or anything like that? Or maybe-- this might be weird-- some kind of poisons maybe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's pretty weird. I'm going to say there, sir, I mean you look pretty weird. That's a "pretty weird request. No, we do not carry poisons."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For dealing with pests on a farm. That sort of thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We have insecticides."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Think that will work on a gnoll?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Insecticide. Pesticide. Herbicide.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: An insecticide generally refers to insects. And we're talking gnolls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But it's usually poison you put--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but you ever chugged a bunch of insecticide? That's a bad day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stuff is stuff, it's bad for anybody. I guess.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it flammable? Do I know if it's flammable?

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: How much is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For about a vial that big? A silver."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're going to have to use a lot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What would that really-- If I were to drink that right now, what do you think that would do to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Probably have some real serious shits for a few days."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's like Visine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow, really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: May I examine it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to look at it. Smell it. Look at the fluid. Do I know anything about this chemical at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. It's a very diluted form of acute poison, to the point where it wouldn't actually affect any larger creature. But if put in a large batch of water used to spray down crops, certain insects-- what are they called again? I forget-- aphids, things like that would die off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aphids? Oh, that's nothing. It won't really do much.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you know about these sorts of things?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sometimes. Not a lot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's very impressive.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nott, you're selling yourself short.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Speaking of-- and I'll ask him for the components to make acid. Does he have that stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. In a very Anarchist Cookbook kind of way. He doesn't sell you acid, but there are the materials available where you could create it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. How much for all this shit? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How many vials' worth are you looking for?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just one? "This will run you about 12 gold."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. That's fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, can you throw a med kit in there with it, if you have any left?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks around. "I'm afraid we're clear out. Bit of a-- "

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have things going on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Lot of things. Sorry."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My apologies."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's okay. I have this pickle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's a good pickle."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it a good pickle, though?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I haven't tried it. I just drank the juice, but he ate it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I ate mine. It was quite good. Now we're just sharing the juice at this point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Guys, let's go kill gnolls.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just the juice?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Juice is great!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It is. With a little whiskey.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groans)

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Picklebacks!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Brine drinkers.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nom nom nom!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like cheeseburger in a shot glass.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, so good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ugh, stop it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we prepared now to go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I have things to do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you sell any healing potions?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I asked that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You asked that already?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I did ask that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Never mind!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We're not really purveyors of healing potions, and those that have are usually held by "the Crownsguard."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, the Crownsguard? Really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We didn't ask Bryce for any healing potions.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should ask Bryce for some healing potions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You actually asked the night before, and Bryce had said that they're currently being used to tend to the people that were in really bad places. It's hard to walk through a war zone and be like, "Hey guys! Do you have supplies?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you need to do for the rest of the day, Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I would really like to get my cat back, so I would need about an hour to go do a little stuff. Do you have anything else to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, there are people getting chopped up and eaten. But if you really want a cat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are we doing? Are we taking our cart?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Take the cart? And get some meat from the butcher?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We might be able to go faster.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think if we were a little spread it would help.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, okay. Maybe I can put it on hold, although I really hate to. But let's come up with what are we doing? What is the plan?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I would follow the direction they left last night. See if we can find a trail.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're just going to go into the belly of the beast? Because one of them shot me and killed me with an arrow. We could draw them out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you just stay behind Caleb. You'll be fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You didn't die, Nott. I saved you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you so much, but I don't want to be in that predicament again! Can we draw them out somehow?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They are fond of meat. Here's my idea. We stage a barbecue contest. Finest in the land! All the best barbecue will be there! And then, when they come to sample our wares, I run and you kill them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, I love that idea. Small thing, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because you want to slow cook that stuff to be really good. It's true.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. Dry aged. Really get a good hickory chip under them. Problem is, people might be dying in the meantime. So if we could find a more expedient solution?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, so were you thinking of having a barbecue here or setting up a barbecue on the road?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm think in the middle of a field, yes. So that it's--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a random field?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It'll take a while to make the signage alone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it seems like less of a trap.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beau had an idea! Get them, Beau! You tell her--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, you take it for her, please.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beau had a fantastic observation. If we happen to see one of those beasts of burden on our way out tracking, maybe we could wrangle one up and use it as a bait.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And if we don't see one, then Fjord, you're the biggest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fair.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Either way, we will probably need the cart.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could also see what they still have at the butcher's.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To bring people back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And bring people back!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And maybe one extra horse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did you say, Molly?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or we could see what else they still have at the butcher's. There's a butcher.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, the butcher got severely cleaned out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we just heard that, he might--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think you're right. Extra horse. We need the cart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To carry one of those beasts if we kill one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If we can try and figure out a way to set up our operation on the edge of the forest so that we're not in the middle of a field, in the open--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, is the point to try to-- I'm sorry, no, you finish your thought.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hills are bad to fight in, unless you're on top of the hill. That's good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not a tactician, but I have a question.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go ahead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we trying to go back to these things where they live? Their lair, their home, their camp? Or are we hoping to luck into them on the road or--?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What it looks like where they're staying, and if we can, without confrontation, get some survivors out of there. That would be ideal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I like that idea as well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe we could have like a survivor round up team and a defense team?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But then how do we get all of the ears?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm just putting it out there: maybe survivors before ears.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can always go back out and get more ears whenever we damn feel like it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get them out. Kill the baddies if we can at the same time, and if not, go back a second time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I thought you said you weren't a tactician, look at you!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's very smart.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Extremely tactile.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caleb's plan! Let's do it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No social graces. Let's do this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go!

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: Break!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we getting another horse?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to ask Bryce if they have a horse to spare.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't you four go get horses? Me and the C-man will go get some incense and stuff.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: C-man? I thought I was the seaman? Fucking get your titles right. Come on, brother, you know you want to! I'm a proud son of a bitch!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry! You're a seaman.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, so now we need time?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to go get a horse, you don't need to be here for that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh god. I really want my cat, but maybe--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go get some incense! I need to buy some tarts.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll get the tarts. Maybe it would be handier as a bird.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You need a tart?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I need a tart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, well, why didn't you say something? Hold on, let me dig.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a bag of pastries!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's this one--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hold on. I think there's a blackberry one somewhere in here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, I can't tell what this used to be.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's kind of gross; I'm sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that the top or the bottom?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have two tarts!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Very stale.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm taking them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'll be tart one way or the other.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we see any crownsguard around? In the street.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over time you will. They're scattered a bit thin and a lot of them are currently focused on either perimeter watch, in case they come back, or helping out those that need help inside the city.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd just like to find one, if I could.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Longish hair that's been heavily braided on the sides and then pinned to the back in a tuft of a ponytail.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Howdy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry to bother, but we've been commissioned by Bryce to make a little expedition to go after those gnolls and we're going to need an extra steed if the Crownsguard has one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We're not allowed to give out any Crownsguard supplies. If you're looking for a "steed, you'd probably have to go to the On the Wind Stables. They're going to be your best bet."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where would those be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right--" and points over towards the northern side of the town. It's one of the buildings that's taken a little bit of fire damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you concerned about the people that live in this town? Clock's ticking on their lives and you want me to go get a steed from another stable instead of saving their lives?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's not--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I sure would hate to have to report this to Bryce. I think they'd be pretty upset about it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Look, I mean no offense whatsoever and if-- I can go find Bryce and see if we-- the "Watchmaster would be much more suited to--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Reggie."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we go to the stables then?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck yeah. Now!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Reggie, this town has been hit hard, you look very weary and maybe a little down on your luck yourself. Maybe I'm just reading into things, but I would gladly pay you a silver for this horse.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let me tell you, Reggie, it would be the best deal you could possibly make. I'm going to use Charm Person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did not make that DC check. Reggie glances over at you. He goes, "Let me see what I can do," and quickly makes his way northward to the outside of the stables.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Very nice!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About five minutes pass and you can hear the clopping of hooves as Reggie comes back with a very obstinate beast on the reins. Dragging it towards you, slowly guiding it. Reggie doesn't seem to be a very trained individual when it comes to handling creatures, especially beasts of burden. "Will this do?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh good, I see you brought us your best, Reggie. Thanks, man.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ignore her, she's very difficult.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hands you the reins.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're a hero. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Best I could do. Good luck."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here's that copper. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hand him a silver also.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you. Thank you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Silver's way too little for a horse.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You said silver and we're being fair!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Just bring it back-- it's on loan! It's on loan."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we come back, it comes back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably. We definitely won't use it as bait for the gnolls. Okay, bye!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We make our way over to where we left our other horse and cart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, easy enough to find. You placed it at a hitching post with a little bit of feed over the evening. Your cart and horse are safe and at your disposal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I saw them take off into the forest. I tracked a little bit right between those trees. I don't know, we can start there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bet they left a lot of tracks and probably some cart things.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know why, I thought you were going to say they left behind poop.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They probably did! Oh my god! They weren't wearing any underwear, were they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They were wearing cobbled-together or scavenged bits of leather and hide armors.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But did it have holes for their butts?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It seemed like most of them would have had some means of disposing of their excrement.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They don't care, they're swinging low and leaving it behind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They weren't very well-dressed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If that's the direction you saw them head off in, check it out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll be on the lookout for cart tracks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As we go, and also, we didn't have time, so here, off you go. I will sit in the cart and go blind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. While you are sending Frumpkin to keep a watch, you are keeping an eye out for tracks. Make a survival check, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not my strongest, but it's okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm keeping an eye out for poop.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 16. No wait! I rolled a natural 16, so 19! I thought it was a 13; I apologize.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very quickly you come upon a number of gnoll footprints in the ground. Seem to be multiple cart tracks. That was the one that you saw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Oh no!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, are there nearby towns? Are there other nearby villages?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There were multiple carts.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, we only saw one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The last one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, can I get like an odd estimate of maybe how many gnolls we might be dealing with based on the amount of tracks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that roll, I'd say you surmise somewhere in the neighborhood of about 18 or so gnolls. From what you can gather on the tracks that you found.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would my Hunter's Bane be useful for that? For tracking these creatures?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can attempt to glean information.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Since they technically have some undead around them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the specific-- sure. Go ahead and make a survival check to see if you can even find those tracks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just a standard one? Standard survival check. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, technically you're tracking undead, so you get advantage on this one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Same degree. You find the tracks, you see there is the remnants of this gnoll horde returning towards a similar direction. You find three sets of cart tracks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I turn to the rest of the group and I go: Good news, we're real stupid if we thought we couldn't track them, because there's a fuckton of them. That'll be easy. Bad news is, oh god, there's a fuckton of them. That's it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that is bad news. Are the carts all heading in the same direction or would they split up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They all converge into one path. They head through the relatively thin woods that surround the northeastern side of Alfield. As you progress on that path out to the other side of the woods, continue into the northeastern fields where the rolling hills begin, these hills seem to go on for miles.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin would be in the air 300-400 feet in front of the cart and I wouldn't do 100% of the time, but I would talk for three minutes and then maybe go: hold on one sec (magic sound effect) and then come back. So intermittent.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tall grass on these rolling hills?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or is it just open fucking hills?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Picked by beasts or--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, no. It's tall grass across the hills--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The grass can vary anywhere from knee-high to chest-high in places. The hills towards the top can get a little more rocky. There are patches where the grass doesn't grow as well and there's open dirt and broken shale. After about an hour or so of tracking in that direction, you come upon the Rillway Road, which is the main road that heads up towards Felderwin. You can see it a little ways off.

lines.name: LIAM
