lines.text: Also, in this time I would have told the rest of the group: Before Nott and I arrived in Trostenwald, just outside the city limits, we were waylaid by gnolls previously and they were hiding in grass just like this. It was very much like this so we should be-- I'm getting very nervous right now looking at it all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In theory, am I actively tracking these creatures? The undead at least.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The undead tracks are falling in line with her tracking. They're moving as a group, but there are far less undead tracks than there are regular gnolls, so as best you can to keep tabs on it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm curious how much of this Hunter's Bane I can actually be using right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'd be leading if she hadn't made an equally good roll, so now both of you are leading this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The grass, is it dead or vibrant green?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vibrant green, for the most part. The wind is picking up a little bit and you can see, especially when you start coming up over some of the bigger hills, you can see the waves cresting over the hillside and causing the shift of it. It's a very beautiful space.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it still the morning hour or about midday?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point now, you've been travelling, we'll say an hour and a half. It's getting close to noon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: High noon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, I know it's actually about 11:37, so we're not quite there yet. By the position of the sun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no! Don't do it! Oh no! (nervous laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's sorry!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was right there!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. Anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Beholder!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't think I'm not tempted.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How rough and how open is our situation right now? Are we in the middle of an open field?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're pretty much in the middle of an open field. But the tracks you can see-- Because you can see the Rillway Road south of you and the tracks begin to shift further north. As they were heading back, they were keeping off the road best they can as well. You also do notice that within the tracks you do find bits of grass that are spattered with drying blood. You don't know how fresh it is. Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Remember how I was like, this is the worst situation to be in?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like this might be the worst situation to be in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Survival?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Perception? Oh no. Did you see that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're having this conversation with Fjord, you're just not paying attention to the road in front of you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: God.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If we're sitting in the cart, is the grass taller than us or is it way lower than us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's about as tall as the cart at times, at times it's lower. You guys do stand out amongst the grass. As you head over the hills, or down below, you are above the grass line without an issue.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Walking on the ground as a human, is it up to here, or--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Waist to chest. It varies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If I stand up in the cart as we go, can I see out into the grass?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, if you wanted.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if I gave Jester a ride on my shoulders? While we walked.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On a moving cart?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What could possibly go wrong?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You've seen Teen Wolf, ja?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In the cart, and I'm holding you. It'd be kind of cool!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll allow it. Go ahead and make a perception check, Jester.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here goes all Jester's teeth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Like a saving throw or just a check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just a check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, roll a 20. Make it happen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's okay. It's a 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You flatten your back out and give a graceful pose as you look ahead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm flying! I'm flying, Jack!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (strained) Yeah, you are!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: King of the world!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are coming up over a hill, you get a good view down, and you can see between the tall grass and the high weeds that are beginning to cluster this vicinity, there is a series of large hills that all break down into this valley where the grass just ends in this area. It looks like it's barren rock and dirt. You notice, with that perception check, a few carts, a few broken boxes, some tables or contraptions. There's some semblance of civilization here amongst these hills off the road.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) There's carts! I see the carts! I jump up and down in her hands.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh god-- (grunts)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there people in the carts?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She drops you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, are there people in the carts? Can I see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They appear to be empty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're empty!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Abandoned?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to start drinking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jester, I'm going to put you down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. How much do you drink?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to take three big swigs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, good to know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would like to use Frumpkin to do a once-around from above to see if any of those beasts are on the horizon anywhere for us to kill, and also if there are any survivors or anything here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check for Frumpkin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13, good to know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we pull the cart over and sneak up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. By foot is how we should proceed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Let's pull the cart over and hide it in the grass.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I help Jester hide the cart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, but our horses. What if they get eaten?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who cares about the horses?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But how are we going to get all the people back if we don't have horses to pull the cart?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: From 100 feet up, I can see through Frumpkin's eyes all of us being a bunch of dumb fucks in the back of the cart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's true.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we leave someone back to protect the horses?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seems a waste.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you want to be the one person that got attacked with the horses by yourself?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I didn't think so. We stick together.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter and groaning)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The crew! The crew groaned!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I heard a groan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That wasn't a groan, that was like-- ugh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Disgust?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was nausea!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I feel like I passed a stone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, what's the plan, guys?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to-- does anybody have to sneeze?

lines.name: TRAVIS, SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Anybody feel like they need to--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Should we?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sneeze? What? Why--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That would give away our stealthy approach.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. I see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because... Bless you! I give you Blessing of the Trickster.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was waiting for the punchline.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What does Blessing of the Trickster do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have advantage on stealth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have advantage on "smealth," that's great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Smealth."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: On "smealth." He who "smealth" it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mm-hmm. All right, what are you guys doing with the cart and the horses?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're hiding it in the tall grass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No rocks around, right? No stones or boulders in the field?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not that big. The hills themselves are-- it's just large rolling hills in this whole valley area.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was trying to get it in the depression of a rolling hill and just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You have to back up a bit to get it out of view.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to point out that we came up with a loose plan, but we're not doing that plan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was our loose plan? We didn't see any of them?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We haven't seen anything yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're not in any tree line or anything.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, in a pinch, we could kill the horses.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kill the horses? Oh, to use as-- that's right, we could.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we won't be able to pull the cart. I'm really strong, but I don't know if I can carry that many people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's lying, she's not really strong.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am really strong, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We wouldn't have to kill the horse, we could just send the horse--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's find out what we see first, and then we'll decide.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure. Recon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's not normally how you test strength.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know, I'm not strong.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's flank. Around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Everybody fan out in a firing line, just one straight line--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going away from each other?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just within eye distance, right? But keep a line.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Answered my question. I was curious what flanking was.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keep in line. We're going to move towards the cart. We're going to use the tall grass.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Towards the three carts?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we need to have some sort of awesome whistle or something? To communicate with each other?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm open to it, if you have any.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whistling)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How about we don't make any noise at all, but we just sneak in?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, let's do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Having placed the cart where what you assume is the best you can hide it, who is helming the hiding of the cart?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a survival check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will also help with that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. If you're aiding, then do it with advantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Lift with the legs!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I mean, sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I get some grass and I put it on the cart.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Put your alarm around the cart! You do it all the time!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we have the time for that right now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How long does it take to cast?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right now, it will take me 11 minutes to do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, do it, do it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: People's lives. Urgency. Clock. Time. All that stuff.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten minutes. Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's just go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What is the marching order?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're coming in as a line together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. What's the order of the line, then?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're all even moving forward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But what is the order of the line?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm to the left of Caleb there on the end.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't want to be on an end. I don't want

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't mind being on an end. How about that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I imagine that the ends are going to be where you need the most strength, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would grab Nott by the shoulder and pull us into the middle somehow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want to be in the middle?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's walk with Molly. There. Boom. Got it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. We have: Molly, Nott, Caleb, Jester, Beau, then Fjord. Okay. I would like you all to make a stealth check, please. As you make your way through the grass.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That helps.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Those monster calves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These are just basic hyenas that are gathered around and are licking the blood that's soaked into the wood. One of them ends up finding a piece of meat, or something that was hanging from one side, and tears it off. Another one comes over (whines) and bites onto it, and they begin tearing and fighting over it before one of them pushes the other over and it (yelps). It goes back and begins licking the blood off the side of the wood. These three hyenas are just scavenging on the outskirt of these carts.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're just hyenas? They're not magical, undead hyenas?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not from what you can tell.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we see how many entrances there are to this mine yard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From this distance, you can't see any entrances.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you think they're centurions?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think they're going to make a big fucking stink if we--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If they see us? I'll bet they're the alert system.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) We should kill them!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But we have to kill them all at once.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is correct.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I could make a distraction. Nott, Beau, are y'all fast, quick, and quiet?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who else?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, just us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm quietish.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's three of them, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You want to try and make a distraction and bring them closer? To us? Then we can jump out of the grass? Do the old "jump out of the grass--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: About how far from the edge of the grass, where we are, to them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 50 or so feet. 60 feet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I use Minor Illusion to create a plump little bunny and have it hop out of the grass? But its front leg looks a little lame.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, buddy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Quietly, this plump, wounded, with a hint of pink to the fur around the arm where it looks like it may have been bleeding a bit, begins to hobble its way silently out of the grass, just beyond the edge.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to hide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to hide.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are still hidden.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to draw one of my swords and, just out of experiment, try and get it to do that weird thing it did yesterday. With my hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a rapid bolt, one of them runs forward and leaps out towards the rabbit and skids into the dirt past it, right to the front of the grassline where you are, Beau.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (slamming)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I use Sacred Flame on the one next it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and who is doing what else?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to stab the third one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The three of you rush out and attack, three individual ones. What are you guys doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will send Frumpkin down to the one that Jester's attacking, right up against it to distract and chirp in its face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Beau, go ahead and attack first.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten? You go to swing, and as it sees you suddenly, it backs away, and your staff hits the dirt right next to it. (snarls) It just barely misses it. Caleb, you following up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb sends Frumpkin right down to the one that Jester was attacking and I will send out a Fire Bolt at the same time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Roll your attack roll for the Fire Bolt.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's at advantage if my birdie is bothering him up close.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. Okay. Wait, you're going for the one that Jester is attacking?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, the one that Jester is attacking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is-- oh, that's good. That is 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: These spells are all still new to me. Oh, that's a big one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One point of damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Big one point of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It begins to burn this small circular image on the hyena's body. (yelping) Go ahead and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It just has to make a dex save of over 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a natural one, he does not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay. Then he gets four more damage, radiant.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's enough. With the blast of the Fire Bolt, and the incineration of the Sacred Flame, you watch as that hyena bursts into fire and flops to the ground while it burns, smouldering, its flesh becoming the meals it had previously feasted upon. Molly and Nott?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 17. My brain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's seven points, plus three radiant.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first strike just completely cleaves it in half, like its momentum, running, almost like it hits the blade, and you hold it out and the momentum just carries it over, seamlessly carving through it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Am I close enough to hit the third one that's still left with my second attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can have movement to close it. There's one right in front of Beau, so you're a little ways away, but you can close the gap, while Nott and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I get my bonus attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fucking-- did you see that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yep. 17 to a three.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You need to not use that dice for the rest of the night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine, again!

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: Nein!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You move out with your heel to go ahead and swing, and it actually ducks underneath and tries to snap at your heel, as Molly closes the gap, and--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you like to go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I release my bolt at that same one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and roll damage. With sneak attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Molly, as you rush up, you watch as a bolt just goes right through the side of the hyena's head, and it just falls lifeless to the ground. All three of them out in a split second.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't want to, like, make y'all alarmed or anything, but that was kind of fucking efficient.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everybody but Beau, you were missing like crazy on that one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, I had a long day yesterday, okay?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hands are sweaty?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just was faster than I thought.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, look! We can use this hyena meat as bait!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go pull my bolt out of the thing. Is it recoverable?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, thankfully it was a clean enough shot, didn't seem to get caught or shatter against any of the bones.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Quick perimeter check to see if we alerted anything, anything's looking at us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing about the vicinity, does not look like anything else is moving or near or has noticed your presence.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Move to the cart, quick check of anything left behind, clues.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we need to drag these bodies?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's no bodies, just blood spatter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you mean the hyenas?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The hyenas.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. We've got to figure out where we're going first.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm also going to point out, they hadn't been eating the hyenas anyway, so maybe leaving bodies of their pets is not the greatest idea?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Toss them into the grass, then, to get them out of view?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That might be a smarter way to go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'll pick them up and throw them as far as I can into the grass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Like a massive shotput, you watch as tiny Jester, with a double spin each, chucks these relatively heavy beasts deep into the grass field, where they vanish with a heavy thud into the field.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's like Miss Trunchbull from Matilda.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're a lot stronger than you look.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you! Hey, what happened to the little bunny, though? I'm going to look for the little white rabbit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh dear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bunny appears to no longer be around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's really sad, they ate it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, boy, sure did.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll have a funeral later.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to keep a hold of my sword, but I'm going to wrap it in the coat so it's not glowing ridiculously.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's just the carts, there's the one mine entrance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't see an entrance to the mine, you just see mining equipment.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, mining. I misunderstood that, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see pieces of equipment, and the interior of this hill valley, this short little valley, seems to have been prepped for some sort of mining expedition.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's no mine hole?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't see one at the moment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll take a look around to see if there's anything, where they started or anything like that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll take the opposite side that he's doing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to look in the carts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You look in the carts, and they are empty. You see a few wayward pieces of cloth, everything in there is bloodied and caked, and has streaks of it being licked up. It looks like the hyenas had been at it for a while, trying to clear off what was left behind from wherever the bodies that were within were taken. I would like you both to make investigation checks, please. And you're following the tracks?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a survival check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because there are undead as a part of this, I will let you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Survival check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like the dust and the dirt in this vicinity has been freshly swept or dispersed intentionally, meaning that once this little valley had been entered, and the carts had been emptied, something was smart enough to intentionally cover their tracks. You, however-- you rolled a 20, you said? As you begin to look about the base of the closest hill, facing away from where you guys had entered, in an eastern direction, you see a pattern of grasses that seem to be interwoven, as opposed to a natural pattern, there is a consistent mesh to the way they've been laid.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a comb-over.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It looks like how we put the stuff over the cart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you glance over, you can see a net of grasses that has been woven and thrown over, leaving a small gap on the edge, where you can see the dark exterior of what was a mine shaft structure entrance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's way smarter that what we did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A ghillie net.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But we'll remember it for the future.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yours was hand-crafted.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't we just take this one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what I was going to say, is it heavy? How big is this thing? Can we fold it up and stuff it in a bag?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about 12 foot by 12 foot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's big.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It could fit in a backpack. Maybe roll up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty thick.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's got sticks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it's thrown on and put against the grass, it doesn't have sticks in its sides.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does it have a frame of any sort?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's laid on the side of the hill.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it's a blanket! Oh, okay. We can take that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can grab it on our way back and throw it on the cart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Throw it on the cart as we're leaving.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I miss being low enough level that we just take everything we find, no matter how useful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like in Skyrim, just wheels of cheese. All the cheese.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to be cracking open clay pots.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The scavenger levels, man. All righty. It is too big for you to carry with you, but it can definitely be taken with you should you exit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How about what's behind the grass, let's discuss this instead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you pull it back, you do see the wooden support structure of the interior of a mine shaft. As soon as you pull it back and look inside, it looks like a barricade has been partially placed up on each side. You see piles of broken furniture, stools and chairs that are shattered and jammed into each other to form some sort of a barricade on each side. You can see dry-rotted pickaxe handles, and other pieces of general wooden beams used for construction that are all pushed up against the sides, with a small path, maybe about three feet wide, that you could walk through to enter. It looks pitch black on the inside. There is no light source outside of what little bit of daylight is coming through from the entrance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry, I was thinking about a thing you were saying, there is a way through for us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a way, there's about a two, three foot gap between this barricade where it made its way in, and once you enter through, you can now see, since there has not been dust put, there is a definitive trail of blood that has dragged through and caked in the loose dirt and dust.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Should I give it a little light, or no?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, before we go in--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're anxious to go. You want to go first?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! Jesus, no. No, please. There were hyenas out here, right, posted as guards? If one of the hyenas had gone (hyena howl), would something have come out of this hole to come get us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, that is a fair assumption, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then why don't we make that sound, and wait for something to come out, and kill it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, but what if it alerts a lot of the gnolls, and then we don't have the element of surprise at all anymore?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we're talking--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You want to go into that dark, scary cave?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It doesn't look that bad to me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It is a dark, scary cave!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Frumpkin is still just a sweet little bird, so I thought maybe a little quick flight in--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Canary in a gnoll mine! (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! Oh, smash!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jesus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have to do it, it's too perfect.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Canary in a gnoll mine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was so painful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do not be sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's limits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know if that's something Frumpkin can do, unless, Nott, you just wanna go in there and go kamikaze.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! I'm drinking again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You are now officially intoxicated.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't have to roll, it just happens?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the next hour.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does that mean?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go in if you need me to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, shit! Oh, shit! Oh, yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No! Oh, wow!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that where "the Brave" comes from?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was going to be my question!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We get her hammered, and she's the most fucking badass.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, this is awesome.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin has been a sparrow before. Sparrows don't have darkvision, do they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a night sparrow, he should have said.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it is a regular sparrow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My only concern is if we draw them out, there could be more than us, right? I just want to get a quick peek, if we can.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I mean, I can send him in there, he'll probably hit the wall a few times, but if there's any fire or anything--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You wouldn't mind?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, you know, I can always bring him back, but be careful, all right? But there he goes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's no light in there. About 25 feet in, go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, you won't be able to see anything through it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21. What faint light is coming in from the interior-- are you looking through?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. As soon as you come inside, about 40 feet in, the shaft widens into a common area. You see a handful of tables, some chairs, similar to what was placed within the barricade, some sacks strewn about, some torn open and scattered across the ground, some that are still lobbed in the corner.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is that from a light source inside, or from sunlight coming in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's where it goes dark, and there's a (thud) as Frumpkin hits a sloping ceiling.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And dies?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, just hits the ground.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Please, no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits the ground, stunned.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's like those birds that hit our windows at home.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's right, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, well, I think I have seen all I am going to see for the moment, but I didn't see anything in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not in that main area.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nothing living in there that I saw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not with what little bit Frumpkin saw with a quick glance before it got too dark and then he hit the ceiling.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Nott, my friend, I think maybe this is a time where you could-- please don't go crazy, but maybe go in 30 or 40 feet, there's a room in there, and I don't think there's anything in there, but you would see.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (drunkenly) I'm just going to go in there and get the gnolls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm gonna bless you before you go. So you can be sneakier.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Consonants are gone!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can sparrows hear?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can hear through my sparrow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could bring the sparrow, you could at least hear what's going on, like a walkie talkie.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like a walkie talkie!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's correct. Richtig. Go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I'll take the sparrow, jam it in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, I don't want to get punched in the face while I'm blind. Somebody please put a hand on my shoulder--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, you got to hold his hand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we going in?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, he's going to go into that other place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If something bad is going to happen, just shake me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll punch you in the face.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, don't do that, just shake me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just tickle his balls.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't do that, just--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Punch him in the balls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You move past the barricades, heading towards the shaft-- the barricade, there's a lot of stuff jammed up here at the front, almost like it was barricaded from the inside long ago, and then was cleared out partially, going through. You make it through the 35 or so feet of the shaft, in towards where it opens up, and you almost trip, because your toe catches something, and you catch yourself, and you look down to see a long piece of rope that was stretched across that just got tugged, and falls slack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, you didn't see that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear a (creak) and with your darkvision glance up and see what appears to be a large log that had been affixed to the ceiling. (whoosh) Comes rushing towards you. Make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are a wee baby rogue!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great check! Disadvantage. Great check!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good! Phew!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is this, dex save?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dex saving throw, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With disadvantage! You, even in your somewhat hazy drunken stupor, see it just in time and back up as it (whoosh) right past your nose and slams into the wall to the left of you. It hits, and you see the dust settle from the ceiling.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That, my lads, was a dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys all hear this (slamming) from the inside.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm okay, it was just wood.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's going on?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've heard a confusing thing. Something fell down, but okay, we're good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we might have lost the element of surprise.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it a bigger space in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is, actually. It opens up to be about 35 feet across from side to side, about 45 or 50 towards the end and then it seems to descend into two different pathways.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Any signs of life? Anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see some of the burlap is dry rotted and pulls right apart, and it looks like there might be some useful things in this chamber.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Real quick, I'll just poke through one of the bags.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check with disadvantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, well then, okay, eight!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance through and find a bunch of mildewed rice grain. Right as you hear a (snort).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will freeze and slowly turn to the sound.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance over, and from the right chamber you see as two gnolls have appeared in the entranceway and have entered up, called from the sound of the heavy impacting thud on the wall but a few moments ago.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you stealthed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both arrive to the top of the-- (sniffing and growling). They both grab their spears.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to say, "Help me! Help me now, please come in, save me, save my life!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Help me, help me now, save my life. We have to go in! Here we go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am going to draw and fire at one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As they're both right there, rushing towards you, you say this and you're going to pull out and fire at one. The one to the right or the left?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The first one who spotted me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that first spotted you would be the one on the left, so as it's rushing towards you, go ahead and fire.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight points of damage, not--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten, 11 points of damage, because I'm going to use Fury of the Small.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those of you who don't have darkvision, you can't see anything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I also uncover my sword at this point, which gives off a little bit of light.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first strike, that is going to be a 21 to hit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Definitely hits. Any of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is six points of piercing damage as the spear jams into your shoulder and scrapes down the front of your chest, glances off the rest of your armor and it hurts, but you're fine. You're still feeling a little fuzzy anyway. The other one attacks, that is going to be a 15 to hit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. This one you do see coming, and you dodge out of the way. But they're both right up in your face right now, snarling and (growling). With that, the guys who have ranged attacks, go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, so the whole party ran in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As that was happening, the two humans in tandem said, "Wait, let them draw out their-- fuck!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's so dark!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys have disadvantage on any of your attacks rolls because you cannot see. You are blind in the chamber.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we doing initiative or are we just going?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For this round, because there's just two gnolls at the moment, I'm just going through actions here to keep going.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dancing Lights!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Guiding Bolt on the one closest to me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eldritch Blast on the other one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so the one that's closest to you will be the one that already took damage from the bolt so roll for attack for the Guiding Bolt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 hits. Roll damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jesus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Six, nine, ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten points?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that's now taken a crossbow bolt to the throat and has taken a Guiding Bolt, this giant blast of light explodes around this gnoll as it yelps and it encompasses its torso with this glittering light. Now the next attack against it has advantage. It is super hurt, but still standing. You're making your attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I rolled the first one, which was a 24, but with advantage. That's less, so 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You were attacking the other one, so you do not get the benefit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, I'm sorry. 24 for the first roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still hits, go ahead and roll damage on that one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh balls, that's--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you using?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eldritch Blast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a d10 for damage. That's a d12.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that is a 12. Sorry, my bad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's the other character.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Old habits, they die hard. Nine points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine points of damage on that one. It gets blasted by the bolt of eldritch energy; however, it's still snarling. Currently they're both looking over at the sudden surge of newcomers.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've also got a distance attack. I'm going to use Devil's Tongue on the one that just survived your hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, what does that do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to use Vicious Mockery. In Infernal: You will feed the dogs in hell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, wow, I understood that. It was scary.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They rolled an eight, minus-- yeah, it does not make the save.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It takes 1d4 psychic, which is three points of psychic damage and has disadvantage on its next attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Got it, great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Four globules of light, Dancing Lights. The room is lit up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The room fills with light at this point. The chamber fills, you can now see the scenery around you. Nott, you're up first. Since you're the first one to get a shot. There's one that's super hurt and one that's kind of hurt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go for the super hurt one. Who's right in front of me, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's wrong?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It fits in there!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah, that's the thing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's what I'm doing. Laura discovered this last week.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It stays up super good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, they're both right up in your face snarling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go to the super hurt one and be like (scream), grab it and I'll do Shocking Grasp.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so go ahead and make your melee spell attack, I believe it is, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep, that's a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 hits.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I don't know how to do this. Hold on, is this a ten? No, that's a ten, this is an eight. Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven it is. As you reach up and grab it with your hand, you watch as a burst of electrical arcane energy surges through its body. You watch as veins pop up its torso to its neck before it collapses into the ground. You have to duck out of the way before it slams. It would have crushed you if you'd stayed in the space you were, but you sidestep in time as the gnoll falls to the ground, lifeless.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Am I in range-- where's the other gnoll, is it right on me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I will bonus action disengage and run all the way around to the other side of the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. On the other side. As you're doing that, the gnoll that's right there sees you rushing off, but now it's more attentive to the one who blasted it there. I'd say, for the sake of distance, since the moment you saw you fired, it probably couldn't close the gap, so it's going to drop the spear, pull out its longbow, and take a shot at you from here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to be a 14 to hit, what's your armor class?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14, all right. Not a great roll, you take four points of piercing damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Four points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'll bruise. That ends the remaining gnoll's turn. Next up would be Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, are there any close to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's only one that's currently standing in the room, the other one's been killed. It was shocked to death by Nott.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'll close the gap and come at it with a big double swing from my staff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Finally a decent roll. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 hits, go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six plus four. That's ten points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel seven different ribs break as it doubles forward. As it looks at you for a second, you take where the staff has broken in and jam upward to where its lungs would be and it (chokes) and falls to the ground, dead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I shake it off my staff a little bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Damn, you broke its ribs to get to its organs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's effective.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singsong) I cut off the ears.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys take a moment here--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Put them in the jar?

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: It's an ear jar!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Our pickle jar--

lines.name: MATT, TALIESIN
lines.text: --Is now an ear jar.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What happened? How'd they find you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. They're very clever. I was sneaking all the way down and they still discovered me. I don't know how.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We look at the rope connected to the log.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, as Nott's saying this, your eyes wander off of her over to the right where you see this heavy tree covered in jagged bark that's (creaking).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That happened after they discovered me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, what are all these bags in here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I was about to go through them, do you want to help?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will keep an eye down the tunnel that they came from while they pillage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll look around. Are there any other entrances?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As you're looking, I'm going to pull all the Dancing Lights down to one and put the rag over it and walk beside Beau so that she can see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both have the wooden frame for support.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wooden

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, you people. We need a corner, and a camera for the corner, and a long paper hat for you to put you in the corner.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't even react to it, he had to point it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking around, it looks like this was a common area. This is the closest chamber to the exterior of the mine. It looks like there were a number of tables here, that a lot of them have been knocked over and broken. A lot of what would have filled this chamber has been pushed into the barricade you saw up front. You're helming the investigation? Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was me. Me and Caleb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're looking in the sacks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, sorry. For the bags, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of the shafts just descend and curve out of view. They go to a steady 45-degree decline.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm helping, no? No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I get advantage because they're helping?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're too drunk to help.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was helping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're looking as well? Sure, take advantage then.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is not as good. Investigation. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11? Okay. You glance around. You find there's an untapped ale barrel, there's an untapped water barrel, there's a hooded lantern that still has a functional bit of oil in it, though it's only about half-full and very rusted over, but you clear off the glass on the outside and it'll work fine. You find a sledgehammer that the handle is not so rotted to the point where it wouldn't be functional, but a fair sledgehammer if you wanted to break any rock or stone. The crowbar that you had seen earlier, that can be acquired.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should write this stuff down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find a small lightweight rod about that long that has a short piece of waxed twine hanging from one end.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it metal, did you say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's not metal. It feels almost like a hard clay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With wax?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a waxed piece of twine on one end.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I make a knowledge test to see if I would know what this is?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A knowledge test? You mean an intelligence check?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, is this intelligence, or what would this be? I'm trying to think-- I might have come across this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You had as good a chance as anybody to have come across this, so if you want to make an intelligence check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just an intelligence check? I'm trying to remember. 11?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You haven't come across one of these.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I have it. Then the water--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A water jug and an ale.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A water jug and an ale jug.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not jug, it was a barrel.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Casks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, so I can't carry that with me? They're big?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, they're big, heavy, filled things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can put them aside. We will be bringing them out of here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You, make an intelligence check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, that's okay. That's, Scheiße, where did it go? Over here, D&D Beyond. It is ten. Yeah, I rolled very low.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten, okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (whispering) Human, want a lantern?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, yes. Did you light it? Is it a lit lantern?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I haven't lit it yet. You can light it, I'll help.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's hooded, so you can close off the light.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, I can close it on and off, right? Like one of those things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Once it's ignited and the oil's lit, yeah, you can open and close the hood.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm one-handed, so I can't really help you light it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, what've we got, are we happy?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I found a small rod and a crowbar and a sledgehammer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you going to carry the sledgehammer?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it heavy?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not for you, Beast Mode.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, you're an alchemist.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does the rod look like crudely made or prettily designed?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Apparently I'm looking it over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, as you're looking over it, it's not beautifully made, it looks functional like a lot of the tools here, there isn't a lot of presentation more than function as what you bring into a mine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, no carving, no glyphs, no nothing like that, just caked in shit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take the rod and smell it and a familiar scent hits your nose. You've worked in your alchemical time with small-level explosives. As part of the elements of the alchemist's fire, there is a reagent catalyst that when the chemicals mix it causes a minor explosion and then burns heavily, there is an element of that, but it's very, very strong and a very intense scent to it. As soon as you smell it, it brings back memories of accidents that have happened in the past on a very small scale. You immediately get this wave of cold shiver down your neck, that this is a very dangerous object if used improperly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It could blow up your face. It could blow up your face. Yeah, it's a boom-boom stick. That's the alchemical term.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think if you put it near fire it could go explode. Who wants to hold it... who is not Jester?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'll take it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Give me my pencil, though. No!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh great, throw a sharp object.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anyone watching at home, the physics was really demanding on that one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I put the sledgehammer on my back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You can sling it in with your--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My shield?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, guys, left tunnel or right tunnel?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll tuck the rod into my belt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's fine, I'll go down the tunnel and scope it out for us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, before we do that, we should remember to check for traps maybe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, can you do that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I certainly can't.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I can't. I can't do any of that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can look for them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I won't be able to find them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can look for them too, I don't know what a trap looks like.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, what did that one look like that you got hit with before?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Big piece of rope, probably should have seen it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe look for ropes crossing the ground.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe we view this an opportunity to grow and we look for those now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will make a mental note.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Look for big pieces of rope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Anything that looks out of the ordinary, out of place. On the wall, on the floors--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Have a peeky-poo around as you go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you still shithoused? Are you fucking hammered still?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, she does this from time to time, she becomes a little unpredictable, but you can't argue with the results, you really cannot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, she needs another shot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You want me to go ahead again?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Which one are we going down, though? There's two entrances, aren't there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are two paths, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go down one, just a little ways, and then I'll come back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should actually stealth, though, this time, okay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will stealth. I'm going to stealth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have a blessing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And search for traps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so make a stealth check first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With advantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh good. Okay, 20-something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, with advantage, but then disadvantage from the drunk, so it's just a straight roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The first roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, good to know. Then you're going to check for traps?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check with disadvantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT, LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: Because you're drunk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That affects-- yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can't tell me what I can do, Matthew.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dexterity-based and intelligence-based checks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's all of the checks. So zero.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh wait, no! No, I did the math wrong, it's ten. I'm drunk, guys!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know the feeling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and which path is this you're checking?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was going to say left. I knew.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I love you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want to check air current temperature? Nothing? Anything?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, little drafts, anything like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't sense any draft, the air is pretty stagnant, actually.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Temperature equal on both sides?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seems to be. On the left path, you do not notice any traps, anything akin to what you stumbled across as you entered. It does seem to descend and curve out of the way, but begin to snake a bit. You get about 15 to 20 feet down before it begins to rapidly curve left and right, it's only about ten feet wide. You can continue if you want.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No thanks. Okay, I'll go back and report what I've heard, or what I've learned.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do either of the two paths have more tracks coming in and out of them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both seem fairly equal. You've been keeping tabs on footfalls in here. There's traffic both ways.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know what could be really handy in this situation is some of that fancy fucking thread of yours.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For keeping things-- alerting us of things coming here or--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I don't mind commiting to one of these tunnels, I just want to make sure nothing comes behind us or comes up from the other way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's a good suggestion. First, what are we doing? What did you find out down that way?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It just keeps going and starts snaking, and there's no traps, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go down the right one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we should also send you down that one as well to have a look around.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, and looking for traps. Stealth with--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, it's straight roll because--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, 25. 24. Something. It's a lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and investigation check with disadvantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Investigation is 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With disadvantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because you're hammered.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. 13.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to curve down the right path and there is a slight depression on one side that you glance over and look and it looks like some of the burlap that had been torn from the sacks earlier in the tunnel had been used to cover a three and a half foot wide pit that has been laced over to hide its presence.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's just burlap over a pit in the ground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's affixed with a couple of rocks in the sides, it's very light and would have fallen through. It only covers part of the path. The tunnel is about ten feet wide and the right side of it is where that pitfall is. You notice it and go. "Oh, hmm." This one does not snake, this one continues in a continual curve for another 40 or so feet before you're starting to get a little far from your friends. You can continue if you want.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It just keeps curving and curving?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like it's going in a downward spiral.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, a downward spiral. Okay, I'll go back and report what I saw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Great album.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So true.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, so one path goes "wiggedy woo" and the other path goes "zibbidy zow."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Were there any traps?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No traps. Oh yes, there was a trap! To be fair, there was one trap. I thought you meant any sprung traps. There was a trap.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You sussed it out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I sussed it out. Don't worry, I'll take care of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far down did you go each way?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 40 feet down the "ziggedy zow" and like 25 feet down the "zibbidy zoo."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, my instinct tells me that if there's something there, that they would trap it so probably more valuable, if we're going on nothing, take the path that is trapped.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I agree.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hear, hear.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're so smart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Unless they want us to think it's the path that they've trapped.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Reverse psychology!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right, and it's actually the path that is least resistance.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Unless they knew that you would think that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, reverse reverse psychology!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: These are dog people? Let's take the path with the trap.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Trap, trap.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Right path.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you all slowly begin to descend down the right path.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're stealthing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll come to that in just a second. We're going to go ahead and take a break. Since it's a little past nine. We'll be back here in a few minutes to pick up the descent further into this mineshaft.

lines.name: LAURA, MATT
lines.text: Into madness.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Down the wooden shaft.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back. We have our two winners in the chat over the break. Congratulations on winning the Wyrmwood package to ding0atx and lunaimperial.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Woo!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, all right. You chose the right or the left again?

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: The right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A faint source of light in the center flickers, a small stone altar holding a cluster of candles in the central level platform. It looks like about six gnoll-like figures have gathered around this stone--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We were stealthing, we were stealthing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. We're going to get to that in just a second.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While a strange seventh figure places small wet stones upon this altar, smaller than the other gnolls. Let's get a perception check real fast from two of you. Who's leading the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would have been bringing them down, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can see in the dark.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I can see in the dark, I'll look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check, both of you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This sucks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, right now, I'll have you guys all do a stealth check, please, as you make your way down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I still have advantage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he has advantage now, sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should probably go back to the other. Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This figure looks gnoll-like, you see the ears and the snout, but as it reaches down and picks up these wet stones and places them in the altar, giving small, dark, muffled barks and yipping sounds, you see elements that look like smooth human flesh. The more that you focus in, you can see this looks to be a humanoid figure that is wearing pieces of hollowed-out gnoll-like armor. A hood missing a jaw that's placed over the top of the head, sections of arms worn like a glove with the hand missing, sifted through. It seems that a lot of the body parts are discolored and rotting a bit, from what you can see from the candle light that's flickering across it. Long bonelike spines, similar to what adorned the armor of that pack lord that you battled in the middle of the city last night, are also affixed to the outsides and pierced through elements of the shoulders and head of this flesh gnoll hide that it's wearing. As it growls, mimicking the sounds of the gnolls that it seems to be residing along, the other gnolls around look, pacing from foot to foot impatiently (growls and grunts). Begins to speak louder and louder at this altar as it places a final wet stone on it. All the remaining gnolls begin to bark in unison together (bark and howl).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whisper) Should we stop this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They all at once leap onto the altar and begin tearing into the stones, which are not stones. They were glistening. At this point you see hearts that are now being torn and swallowed by the gnolls at the altar.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we kill them all?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't make a sound.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (vomiting)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that was well done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They finish devouring the hearts and the humanoid figure begins to bark a few more times and then in broken Common says, "The hunger will be fed: ours and hers. Come," and points to two of them, "Help me carry more meat below. The rest, stay. Feast on what remains." Turns around and you now look across the way. On the other side of the chamber, darkened, you see a gnoll leaning in familiar armor: the one that you had battled and had left with the carts is watching from the far end of the chamber down on the lower third-level platform.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The big mama jama?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The weird gnoll priest, I guess you could say at this point, that's been helming this little ritual, goes and joins the armored gnolls and steps aside and follows second, and the two gnolls that were assigned by it leave as well, leaving four in there in the chamber currently.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Including the armored one or no?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the armored one leaves with the priest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you describe any light source in here that they're working by?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The candle altar. Yeah. It's not an extremely bright light, but for those of you who are human, it's enough where you can make out shapes once your eyes have adjusted to the low light interior.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as they begin to grab the bodies on the ground. You can see there are now-- The grinding of bones as they drag broken corpses across the floor and begin to tear into the torsos.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: While that's happening, I'm going to cast, very quietly, Cure Wounds on Nott next to me, because I saw you're bleeding, yo.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, sorry. What does that do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You just regained nine hit points.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, nine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is getting ridiculous.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (barking) You watch as four hyenas fill into the space where the gnolls are and begin to sit at bay, waiting for the gnolls to finish feasting. One of them gets close, and the gnoll just grabs its head and shoves it against the wall, and it snaps into the wall and then backs up and then waits its turn. You can see the other hyenas that exist in this space, naturally scavengers, have to wait, being at the lowest of the totem pole.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How many total?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four gnolls, four hyenas.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The one that got thrown into the wall? It got stunned or hurt, it didn't get any--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It didn't seem to be too much. More to just keep it away from the meal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We know they go down very quickly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm afraid if we keep waiting, more will just show up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Let's kill them!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispering) Here we go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? We're just going to go? There's no plan?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, maybe we can draw a few over to us and take them out on our terms.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're planning to engage, should I show you the layout of where they're placed?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He says coyly. "Would you like to see the layout of the room?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't like seven on eight. I am not a fan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seven?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But they're little.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The hyenas are little.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, Yasha's with us, right? (laughing)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The hyenas are just doggos.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, they've got like four hit points. You can take out two of them in one go. If you were, you know, Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So here we have--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, one's an archer, two's an archer, three's an archer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They all tend to carry a bow on their backs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit, four's an archer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're scooting at the sides, waiting for them to finish their meals. You guys are right up here where the shaft opens, glancing down into this chamber. That was where the priest and the other gnolls had exited.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're up on top, up there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are up on here. Which, for the purposes of--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good thing we're metal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, I hate it, but--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there any way to even the playing field a bit? Any strategy? Fjord and Caleb, come on?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about the boom stick that you have? We can chuck it into the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Wouldn't that be really loud? Wouldn't that draw them back, though?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, it would, but--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus we're in a mine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It might bring the whole thing down on us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe we could use that to escape later.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, definitely.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's a big column that's in between them, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it a column or a stalagmite?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like it was a stalactite that then was reinforced as a column to help maintain the structure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If we can make some sort of distraction, to get their attention, and if we can put or heavy hitters, our people up front, we can try and hold them in this mouth, ranged people in the back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want to throw the rod at the column?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because we're not going to be able to get to anything.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's another path down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well yeah, but this is very loud. It would draw things up here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where would you want this distraction to be? Because I can make a little--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Behind them, and make them turn away from us. Because we're in a fatal funnel up here at the top.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can make a little dancing golden person of light appear down at the bottom of the passage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A fifth gnoll begins to wander its way into the chamber.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You see, more are going to keep coming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It goes over and kicks one of the hyenas off to the side. It sits there (snuffling and whining).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can see now or try the other way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If there's more in there, they're just going to come in here anyway.

lines.name: BEAU
lines.text: And it's not confined.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I genuinely feel like we should go the other way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The other way? This is it, this is the other way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's a whole other path.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's nothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's nothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you know?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I'm guessing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here's the question: do you think these things are going to come out of here right away, or is it worth a shot? Maybe there is a way around, to a way they're not expecting?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're here looking for villagers, remember?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, there's nothing saying we have to run in here if we're not feeling this. We can backtrack and look in the other direction. In fact, I'm leaning that way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Matt. DM question? If we were to try and back out of here, and draw them towards us, what would that be? Just a tunnel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, this tunnel is a ten-foot wide tunnel that continues backward.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plus we do have a map here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Five gnolls. We've got these guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can try attacking them, and if it gets bad, then we use the TNT.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Use D&D?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's what I heard.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D&D?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, TNT.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The longer we wait, the more things are coming.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe it's the whiskey talking, but I think we've got these guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you wanted to, turning you backward here, there's this path here. We could continue the tunnel back this way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's only a death funnel if we're the ones dying, right? If they're dying, that's good for us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far is it on the map from where we're standing to the farthest gnoll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The farthest gnoll there? About 60 or so feet.

lines.name: SAM
